content.description:
The boiling points of two diatomic elements are listed in the table shown.

Substance
 <math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
 <math alttext="I 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

Boiling point <math alttext="(in kelvin)" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>K</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>
 <math alttext="239" overflow="scroll"><mn>239</mn></math>
 <math alttext="457" overflow="scroll"><mn>457</mn></math>
content.question: Which statement best explains the observed difference in the boiling points?

choices.label: Iodine has the larger electron cloud, so molecules of <math alttext="I 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> are more polarizable.
Iodine has the lower electronegativity, so molecules of <math alttext="I 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> are more polar.
Chlorine has the smaller atomic radius, so molecules of <math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> contain weaker bonds.
Chlorine has the higher electronegativity, so molecules of <math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> are more polar.

content.answer: Iodine has the larger electron cloud, so molecules of <math alttext="I 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> are more polarizable.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
